questions.text: He was accused ___ stealing company property.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'Accused of' is the right phrase.

questions.text: The report was written ___ reference to the new regulations.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'With reference to' means concerning or about.

questions.text: She acted ___ accordance with the company’s policy.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'In accordance with' means following the rules or standards.

questions.text: The project was delayed ___ account of bad weather.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'On account of' means because of.

questions.text: She spoke ___ behalf of the entire team.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'On behalf of' means representing someone.

questions.text: The new system was introduced ___ order to improve efficiency.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'In order to' means for the purpose of.

questions.text: The manager acted ___ response to customer complaints.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'In response to' means as a reaction to.

questions.text: The team succeeded ___ spite of many difficulties.

choices.explanation: Incorrect. The phrase is 'in spite of'.

questions.text: We finished the project ___ time.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'On time' means punctual, not late.
Incorrect. 'In time' means before the deadline, slightly different meaning.

questions.text: She worked hard ___ order that she could buy a house.
The company is committed ___ reducing waste.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'Committed to doing something' means dedicated to it.

questions.text: He succeeded ___ virtue of hard work.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'By virtue of' means because of.

questions.text: The decision was made ___ regard to the company’s policy.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'With regard to' means concerning or relating to.

questions.text: The building was destroyed ___ fire.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'Destroyed by fire' means the fire caused the destruction.

questions.text: He was praised ___ his honesty.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'Praised for' is the right phrase.

questions.text: She’s been absent ___ work for two days.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'Absent from' is the proper expression.

questions.text: The company operates ___ accordance with international standards.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'In accordance with' means following the rules.

questions.text: The results were achieved ___ means of careful planning.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'By means of' means through the use of.

questions.text: The event was cancelled ___ to bad weather.

choices.explanation: Incorrect. The correct form is 'due to'.

questions.text: He was found guilty ___ theft.

choices.explanation: Correct. 'Guilty of' is the right preposition.
